intro: Spermacoce scaberrima, commonly known as the rough sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and clearings. Its foliage is often covered with fine hairs, giving it a rough texture.
